result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven J Koth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:22 PM Defendant Steven J Koth in court.  Attorney Eric Sheets in court for Steven J Koth.  Attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Zima gives the court her sentencing recommendation. Amended information is brought in. HDK appears in court. Victims rights have been complied with. Attorney Sheets makes a statement regarding sentencing. Defendant makes a statement to the court. Victim HDK appears in court and makes a statement.
in support of defendant
in support of defendant
Final pre-trial on October 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
May have contact with H.D.K. in the hospital. May have contact by phone with H.D.K. for counseling.

9:20 AM Attorney Eric Sheets appeared by phone for Steven J Koth.  Attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for State of Wisconsin. Alleged victim appears in person.
Alleged victim is requesting that no contact be removed from bond. State is opposed. 
Attorney Sheets states defendant does not appear because he is hospitalized. He asks that alleged victim be allowed to visit him in the hospital.
Court orders that alleged victim, H.D.K., may have contact with defendant in the hospital. Defendant may attend counseling with alleged victim by telephone.
Letter from defendants wife regarding bond condition modification
Bail/bond hearing on September 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.

9:05 AM Prosecuting attorney David R. Knaapen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven J Koth in court.  Attorney Eric Sheets in court for Steven J Koth. 
Defendant waives the preliminary hearing. Not guilty pleas are entered. Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:02 PM Prosecuting attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven J Koth in court.  Attorney Eric Sheets appeared by phone for Steven J Koth.  H.D.K. makes a statement to the Court requesting that the no contact provision be lifted so the parties can spend the 4th of July holiday together.  Attorney Oswald makes a statement opposing the request.  Attorney Sheets makes a statement to the Court stating that H.D.K. contacted his office. 

Court denies the motion.
Email from Br. 2 JA sending Notice of Hearing to victim regarding a reprieve from bond conditions w/ victims letter that was sent to the court
Hearing on June 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on July 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
9:07 AM  Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven J Koth in court.  Attorney Eric Sheets in court for Steven J Koth. 
Transferred to Branch 2 for preliminary hearing. Alleged victim is requesting that no contact condition be removed from bond. State is opposed. Court denies motion to modify conditions of bond. Bond is continued. Law enforcement may assist with defendant moving things out of property.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
